Key Match Events: Josh Giddey finished with 14 points, 12 rebounds, and six assists as the Bulls outlasted Charlotte at the Spectrum Center 115-108 in overtime.
Giddey went 4-for-16 from the floor, making one 3-point shot and four of his free throws, including two with 14 seconds remaining to ice it.
In the first quarter, Josh Giddey only had two points as the Chicago Bulls were cold from anywhere, with the Hornets building a 24-15 lead after the first 12 minutes.
Giddey added seven points in the second quarter, including two late free throws toward the end of the half to give Chicago a 52-46 advantage.

Giddey only had four points in the final 29 minutes of the game, two in the third quarter, zero in the fourth, and two in overtime. He put the game to bed with two clutch free throws with 14 seconds remaining.
Pre-Game Insights: The Bulls wanted to finish the year strong and enter 2025 with momentum, having been inconsistent throughout the first two months of the season.
Post-Match Reflections: The Bulls ended the year on a two-game winning streak, improving to 15-18 for the season. They currently sit ninth in the Eastern Conference standings and are primed to finish in the Play-In Tournament spots.
